title: Are the Rolling Stones still good live? - Quora

response.answer_text: Were they ever? I’ve never seen them live. I actually stopped going to stadium concerts when I was like 15… most of the bands I tend to listen to play in bars or sometimes larger clubs. Punk bands, folk performers, noise and electronic and even some metal bands. And some rock bands. I want to be a part of the concert, not witness it from 100 yards away, and you can’t do that in a stadium. But I do enjoy listening to live music albums. Some of my favorite albums by some of my favorite bands are the live ones. I must own 20 live bootlegs of The Velvet Underground. Many musicians… from Led Zeppelin to Pigface to Ani DiFranco to Guitar Wolf to Oingo Boingo to Moby… are better live than in the studio. They get to improvise, they get to capture the energy of their music in a way no one ever could under artificial settings like a studio. I suppose I’m dating myself. I can’t speak much for musicians who debuted over the past 10 years. I do like the Rolling Stones. I have favorite albums (Let It Bleed, Undercover, Flowers) and favorite songs (2000 Man, Gimme Shelter, Stray Cat Blues.) But their live albums? Listen to Jumpin’ Jack Flash from Get Yer Ya-Yas Out. They somehow make it sound less energetic and less rebellious than the vinyl version. How do they do that?  Still Life was another waste, in my humble opinion. A collection of half-hearted live renditions of studio songs that come off more like the mechanical performance of someone performing a job duty… not a live expression of art.  Love You Live, Flashpoint… more and more of the same. Lower sound quality versions of the studio recordings, nothing more. Now, compare those albums to The Velvet Underground Live 1969, Lou Reed Rock and Roll Animal or Led Zeppelin The Song Remains the Same. Every single song on every one of those albums is either more energetic, extended or arranged into an entirely different song. They are simply more interesting. Again, I’m not knocking the Rolling Stones. I think, at one point or another in my life, I’ve owned every Rolling Stones album up to and including Flashpoint. Their live ones were always underwhelming. I think the only one I actually liked was Got Live if You Want It. Maybe because that was early in their career, before they started thinking of the band as a job.  Now, that’s energy. That’s punk. 8 D

I saw them for the first time in my life on 25 June 2019 at Soldier Field in Chicago, and I was surprised by how good they were. Mick’s been living a healthy lifestyle since at least the early ‘80s—I saw a photo of him running seven miles barefoot on the beach in The Runner magazine back then—and Ronnie’s been sober for a decade as I write this and probably living a healthy lifestyle as well. Mick and Ronnie had tons of energy onstage. Keith was a little feeble. Charlie was Charlie: a rock. So, yes, Virginia, they are still good live, and they might even be better than their unsober, “sloppy” years.
I saw them in 2005 and they were awesome. They have and probably will always be a great live band.
Hell yes! I had the chance to see them live when they went to Cuba. They still rocking and Jagger is unstoppable on the stage.This was on 2016,Good memories! lml
Seen them 5 times - ’67 was mind blowing. ‘77 fabulous show. ‘80 certainly worth the time. ’94 eh… 2012 waste of time and money - kinda ruined earlier memories.
